summary: The Ecosystem Architecture series explores how the concept of ecosystems, traditionally bound by space and time in biology, is redefined in modern contexts to describe decentralized, non-hierarchical organizations. Drawing inspiration from various fields, this series examines how decentralization and regenerative practices can help build innovative ecosystems that thrive beyond geographic boundaries.
excerpt: Biological ecosystems are defined by space and time, but modern ecosystems transcend these. Ecosystem architecture proposes decentralized, non-hierarchical structures inspired by diverse disciplines.
